cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 555 miles E of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest then west-southwest, pass over the northwestern Bahamas mid-week, make landfall along the east-central Florida coast late Wednesday night/early Thursday, cross Florida, then curve northward toward Georgia and the Carolinas by Friday-Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (near or north of West Palm Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch currently limited to the northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet; expected later for portions of Florida and possibly the Georgia/South Carolina coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas, Florida east coast, and the southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (but increasing) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into Saturday; peak probability 15% (34 kt) and 5% (50 kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No official surge forecast for Georgia yet; minor surge (1-3 ft) cannot be ruled out if Nicole re-emerges over the Atlantic near the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands from Nicole could bring 2-4 inches with locally higher totals (>4 in) Fridayâ€“Saturday, producing urban and low-lying flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and coastal erosion along Georgia beaches; possible river/flash flooding inland.
